member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_NOT_OPENED

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_UNABLE_SYNCHRONIZE

member.summary: A message receiver can not register for threads synchronization.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclErrors.WCL_E_MR_SYNC_OBJ_NOT_CREATED
member.summary: A thread synchronization object has not been created.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclHelpers
member.summary: This static class includes some helpers methods used in WCL.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.CreateMutex(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new mutex with given name.
member.param: Set this to True to create a process-dependent unique mutex. Otherwise system wide named mutex will be created.
The optionam parameter (default value is false indicates if the Mutex must be owned by a called.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is the Mutex handle. If the function failed the return value is zero.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.IncPtr(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Increments a pointer on given offset.
member.returns: Returns a new pointer.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.ZeroHGlobal(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Zeros the memory allocated by the AllocHGlobal.
member.param: The InPtr returned by the AllocHGlobal method.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.AllocHGlobal(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates and zeros memory.
member.returns: InPtr value for allocated memory or InPtr.Zero in case of out of memory.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.HResultFromWin32(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts Win32 error code into HRESULT.
member.returns: HRESULT value represents the given Win32 error code.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.Succeeded(System.Int32)
member.summary: Provides a generic test for success on any status value.
member.param: The status code. This value can be an HRESULT or an SCODE. A non-negative number indicates success.
member.returns: True if Status represents a success status value; otherwise, False.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.Failed(System.Int32)
member.summary: Provides a generic test for failure on any status value.
member.param: The status code. This value can be an HRESULT or an SCODE. A negative number indicates failure.
member.returns: True if Status represents a failed status value; otherwise, False.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.wclGetWinVer(System.UInt16@)
member.summary: Reads Windows OS version.
member.param: On output contains the OS build number.
member.returns: Returns OS version.

remarks.para: For Win 10 Build can be translated to OS version (release) using table below.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.wclIsWinIot
member.summary: Checks if software runs on Windows 10 IoT.
member.returns: The function returns True if it runs on Windows 10 IoT. Otherwise it returns False.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.LoWord(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns Lo Word of the UINt32 value.
member.returns: The Lo Byte.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.HiWord(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns Hi Word of the UInt32 value.
member.returns: The Hi Byte.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.LoByte(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Returns Lo Byte of the UInt16 value.
member.returns: The Lo Byte.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclHelpers.HiByte(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Returns Hi Byte of the UInt16 value.
member.returns: The Hi Byte.

summary.para: Suspends the current thread until the specified condition is met. Execution resumes when one of the following occurs:
* An I/O completion callback function is called.
* An asynchronous procedure call(APC) is queued to the thread.

param.name: Milliseconds
param.para: The time interval for which execution is to be suspended, in milliseconds.

A value of zero causes the thread to relinquish the remainder of its time slice to any other thread that is ready to run. If there are no other threads ready to run, the function returns immediately, and the thread continues execution. Windows XP: A value of zero causes the thread to relinquish the remainder of its time slice to any other thread of equal priority that is ready to run. If there are no other threads of equal priority ready to run, the function returns immediately, and the thread continues execution. This behavior changed starting with Windows Server 2003.
A value of 0xFFFFFFFF indicates that the suspension should not time out.

returns.para: The return value is false if the specified time interval expired.
The return value is true if the function returned due to one or more APC functions.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclMessageSynchronizationKind
member.summary: Message synchronization methods used to inter-threading synchronization and notification.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclMessageSynchronizationKind.skDefault
member.summary: Default synchronization method based on Windows Messages.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclMessageSynchronizationKind.skNone
member.summary: Asynchronous notifications. Synchronization is not used. All events will fire in "free" (undefined) thread.

member.name: F:wclCommon.wclMessageSynchronizationKind.skApc
member.summary: Asynchronous Procedure Call (APC) synchronization.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclMessage
member.summary: The message object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessage.Free
member.summary: Frees the message object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessage.#ctor(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Create a new message object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessage.AddRef
member.summary: Increments the reference count for an object. This method should be called for every new reference to an object.
member.returns: The method returns the new reference count. This value is intended to be used only for test purposes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessage.Release
member.summary: Decrements the reference count for an object.
member.returns: The method returns the new reference count. This value is intended to be used only for test purposes.
member.remarks: When the reference count on an object reaches zero, Release causes the object to free itself. When the released pointer is the only existing reference to an object, the implementation frees the object.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclMessageEvent
member.summary: The OnMessage event prototype.
member.remarks: The Message object is valid only inside an event handler.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver
member.summary: The message receiver object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.DoMessage(wclCommon.wclMessage)
member.summary: Fires the OnMessage event
member.remarks: The Message parameter is valid only inside the method. The method is always called in the same thread which was used to create the receiver.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new message receiver object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.Finalize
member.summary: Frees the message recevier.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.Close
member.summary: Closes the receiver and stops listening for the messages.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: The method must be called from the same thread which was used to create the receiver.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.Open
member.summary: Opens the receiver and start listening for the messages.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: The method must be called from the same thread which was used to create the receiver.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.Post(wclCommon.wclMessage,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Posts the message into the messages queue.
member.param: The object represents a message. A caller is responsible to dispose the message object passed into the method.

param.name: Sync
param.para: If the Sync parameter set to True and the thread that called the method is the same that opened the receiver the message will be delivered without putting it into the message queue.
If the thread that posting the message is different than one that opened the receiver or the Sync parameter is False (the default value) the message will be posted into the message queue.

member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: The method can be called from any thread.
Note that if sync messages is posted it can be processed before any other message in the queue.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.Listening
member.summary: Gets the receiver's state.
member.value: True if the receiver is listening for the messages.

member.name: E:wclCommon.wclMessageReceiver.OnMessage
member.summary: The event fires when a new message has been received.
member.remarks: The event always fires in the same thread which was used to create the receiver.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster
member.summary: The message broadcaster manages broadcast messages between subscribers (message receivers subscribed for broadcast messages). Also the message broadcaster monitors changes in the hardware configuration and notifies subscribers about the changes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster.#ctor
member.summary: Create the message broadcaster.
member.remarks: An application must never create the broadcaster directly. It is created when needed by the message receivers.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster.Dispose
member.summary: Frees the message broadcaster.
member.remarks: An application must never destroy the broadcaster directly. It is destroyed when not needed any more by the message receivers.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster.Broadcast(wclCommon.wclMessage)
member.summary: Broadcasts a Messgae to all message receviers.
member.param: The object represents the message. A caller is responsible to free the Message object after procedure call.
member.returns: If the function succeed the returns value is . Otherwise the function returns one of the WCL error codes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster.GetSyncMethod
member.summary: Gets current the inter-threading synchronization method.
member.returns: The current inter-threading synchronization method.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclMessageBroadcaster.SetSyncMethod(wclCommon.wclMessageSynchronizationKind)
member.summary: Changes the current inter-threading synchronization method.
member.returns: If the function succeed the returns value is . Otherwise the function returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: An application must call this method to change the current inter-threading synchronization method before any other call to WCL.

member.name: T:wclCommon.wclThread
member.summary: The class allows to use WCL components in threads, console and service applications.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclThread.OnInitialize
member.summary: The method called by the thread when it just started. An application must override this method to execute initialization code.
member.returns: If initialization completed successfully the function must return True. Otherwise the function must return False.
member.remarks: The default implementation always returns True.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclThread.OnSignal(System.UInt32)
member.summary: This procedure is called when a signal received from the other thread.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclThread.OnTerminate
member.summary: The procedure is called when the thread is about termination. An application must execute all finalization code here.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclThread.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new Thread object.
member.remarks: The constructor does not start th thread.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclThread.Finalize
member.summary: Frees the thread object.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclThread.Run
member.summary: Starts the Thread execution.
member.returns: If the function succeed the returns value is . Otherwise the function returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: The method waits for thread initialization (see OnInitialize method description.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclThread.Terminate
member.summary: Terminates the thread.
member.returns: If the function succeed the returns value is . Otherwise the function returns one of the WCL error codes.

members.member: Posts signal to the Thread. The user defined Signal ID. /// If the function succeed the returns value is . Otherwise the function returns one of the WCL error codes. The signal is posted to the thread. That means that the method does not wait when the Thread receive and processs the signal. Also the method can not know if thread processed the signal.

member.name: P:wclCommon.wclThread.Running
member.summary: Gets the thread state.
member.value: True if the Thread is running. False otherwise.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclWinUsb.wclLoadWinUsb
member.summary: Loads the WinSUB subsystem.
member.returns: If the function completed with success the return value is . Otherwise the function returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: An application must not call this function. Instead it must use high-level WinUSB functions and classes.

member.name: M:wclCommon.wclWinUsb.wclUnloadWinUsb
member.summary: Unloads the WinUSB subsystem.
member.returns: If the function completed with success the return value is . Otherwise the function returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: An application must not call this function. Instead it must use high-level WinUSB functions and classes.
